analyzed: jātaka  duka nipāta  bīraṇa thambha vagga

translated: The Birth Story of the Crooked Merchant
“This is the well-thought-out trick of a crook,
A hidden trap set for a trap.
If mice could eat a plow,

original: Kasmā kumāraṁ kulalā na hareyyuṁ.🔽Kūṭassa hi santi kūṭakūṭā,
analyzed: kasmai kumāram kulalāḥ na hareyyu  kūṭassa hi santi kūṭa kūṭā
translated: Why wouldn’t the mice carry off the boy?🔽For a crook has many crooked tricks,
And a thief has many ways of stealing.

analyzed: dehi putta naṭṭha phāla naṭṭhassa phāla
translated: Give the plow to the one who lost the plow,

analyzed: mā te putta mahā asi phālana ṭṭho ti
translated: Don’t let the one who lost the plow lose his son.”
The Eighth: The Birth Story of the Crooked Merchant
